description.narrative:
The final phase of Danida's support to business sector development in Vietnam is designed as a phasing-out support over a period of three years (2011-2013). It is prepared with a view to consolidate the achievements of the previous support to the Vietnamese private sector 2005-2010 and focus on sustainability and further alignment with national structures. The programme's objective is to strengthen the competitiveness of Vietnamese growth- and export-oriented enterprises and create decent jobs.
The programme focuses on three components to (1) directly support SMEs in selected provinces through the Global Competitiveness Facility (GCF), (2) continued support to labour protection and (3) improve business sector research capacity for guiding economic policy-making. The support under Component 2 is rendered as the sector budget support to the National Programme on Occupational Safety and Health 2011-2015. In the absence of defined national programmes in the relevant fields, Components 1 and 3 continue to use the successful implementation arrangements of the first phase of the programme support.
The BSPS Phasing-Out Support is anchored in the Central Institute of Economic Management (CIEM) under the Ministry of Planning and Investment (MPI), which is the programme partner.
Based on the mid-term review's recommendation, it was decided that the programme would be extended with one more year until 2014.

mailing-address.narrative: Embassy of Denmark, 7th Floor, BIDV Tower, 194 Tran Quang Khai Street
